title: We Found the 80+ Best Cyber Monday Deals to Shop on Laptops, Vacuums, TVs and More
description: From Amazon to Best Buy and Target, our CNET shopping experts have gathered the most enticing Cyber Monday deals all in one place.
author: Adam Oram
excerpt: From Amazon to Best Buy and Target, our CNET shopping experts have gathered the most enticing Cyber Monday deals all in one place.
text: Our expert, award-winning staff selects the products we cover and rigorously researches and tests our top picks. If you buy through our links, we may get a commission. Reviews ethics statement Adam Oram Senior Editor Adam Oram is a Senior Editor at CNET. He studied Media at Newcastle University and has been writing about technology since 2013. He previously worked as a Senior Writer at iMore, Deals Editor at Thrifter, and as an Apple Genius. His spare time is spent watching football (both kinds), playing Pokémon games, and eating vegan food. Expertise Deals | Apple CNET’s expert staff reviews and rates dozens of new products and services each month, building on more than a quarter century of expertise. Don't worry if you missed Black Friday because Cyber Monday deals have already begun. You still have time to cash in on some of the best discounts of the year, whether you're looking for TVs, laptops, gaming gear, headphones or mattresses. Sorting through the sheer volume of sales can be overwhelming, but we're helping you save time and money by actively tracking all the best deals from Black Friday through Cyber Monday and beyond, so you can skip past the mediocre offers. Check off items on your holiday gift list or treat yourself to a new gadget for your home. Whatever you're looking for, be sure to checkout before these special discounts end.Consider this page your go-to guide and let us take on the hassle of sorting through the best deals for you. We'll continue to regularly update here with the top picks from CNET's shopping pros, covering Black Friday weekend through Cyber Monday. Be sure to check back often so you don't miss out on the hottest deals.Best Cyber Monday deals The latest and greatest ebook reader from Amazon is good for a marathon reading session with its 12 weeks of battery life. Better still, the ebook reader has a refreshed display with even faster page turns and a perfect paper-like contrast ratio. It's the perfect reading companion.  Blast 80W sound for almost $80 off with this wearable boombox. Soundcore's Motion line brought the noise this year with a slew of great Bluetooth speakers, but the Motion Boom Plus is perfect for bringing to the beach or to the gym when you're leading a yoga class thanks to its long, detachable strap. Its 13,400mAh battery can play 20 hours of music or play power bank to your phone or tablet. Calling all gamers. If you're looking to get your hands on a new console, grab this deal that brings down Sony's Slim PS5 to the lowest price we've seen. Get three Outdoor 4 security cameras to help keep your home secure. These cameras are weather-resistant and have a strong battery life using AA lithium batteries. It even made our list of best home security cameras for 2024. You'll also get a free $20 Best Buy gift card with your purchase. Save $160, free $20 Best Buy gift card Take more than half off this travel-perfect dual port Spigen charger. The Dyson V8 is a somewhat older model but still an extremely reliable, powerful Dyson vacuum for hundreds less than the brand's latest cleaning tech. This beautiful coffee maker is a work of art, and it brews outstanding coffee. The over-$100 discount makes it all the more enticing as a gift for yourself or a fellow coffee lover. Razer Viper V2 Pro HyperSpeed wireless gaming mouse: $80 (save $70). This mouse is a solid tool for competitive PC gaming thanks to its lightweight edge and it's now at the lowest price we've seen in 2024. Aqara U100 smart door lock: $130 (save $100). This smart lock supports Apple's Home Key technology, Amazon's Alexa and more.Govee TV backlight 3: $47 (save $23). This kit adds lights to the back of your TV that sync up with whatever you are watching or playing, and kits for multiple TV sizes are all discounted today.Prusa MK4S 3D printer: $999 (save $100). One of the best 3D printers of 2024 is discounted by $100, and the top-rated MK4S also comes with $300 worth of free gifts.Panasonic DP-UB820 4K Blu Ray player: $350 (save $150). If you still enjoy physical media, this player delivers smooth performance, including solid image and sound as well as support for HDR10 Plus, Dolby Vision and Hybrid Log-Gamma.Best Cyber Monday TV dealsWe're serious about TVs here at CNET, and the proud owners of a light-controlled TV Test Lab at our New York City office. As our shopping editors evaluate the best Cyber Monday deals on TVs, we cross-reference the discounts with the results of our rigorous hands-on testing -- and consult our dedicated TV editors and writers, too. These are our favorites right now.  LG/CNET A 55-inch display is large enough for most spaces, and this particular model is equipped with an OLED screen. It also has Dolby Atmos sound, Dolby Vision, an A11 AI processor with upscaling and gaming features such as Nvidia G Sync, AMD FreeSync Premium and up to 144Hz refresh rate. Snag this TV while it's at an all-time low price.  Show more The TCL QM8 offers superior brightness levels and top-notch picture quality thanks to its use of cutting-edge mini-LED technology. No wonder it was our top pick for the best TV set of 2024.  Looking for the best picture quality on the market? Nab this Samsung TV with a 55-inch OLED glare-free display. It also has 4K AI upscaling capabilities, as well as HDR Pro, Dolby Atmos sound and Object Tracking Sound Plus. This smart TV defines "Go big or go home." It's 85 inches, making it almost too big for most spaces, but just right for those who love watching movies large and loud or like to catch all the details of any sport you can imagine. Its smarts come from Google TV and includes a subwoofer built-in to make the sound experience better in almost every case. Outdoor TVs are built differently compared to the wishy-washy indoor TVs. They have large surroundings that keep them from getting too hot or too cold, and they can withstand water splashes. This 43-inch 4K TV from Sylvox runs Google TV as well, so you can hang out on your deck and stream your favorite shows in the sunshine. With this Best Buy deal, you can upgrade your TV for $400 less this Black Friday. It even has Dolby Vision for film buffs and Nvidia G-Sync for gamers. This 2024 TV with Dolby Atmos has an anti-reflection display to show off fine art when you're not using your TV. Hisense 65-inch CanvasTV: $800 (save $500). This TV has a matte screen to make it appear more like art than tech without sacrificing any of the smart tech to keep you streaming the good stuff.Roku Plus 75-inch QLED TV: $750 (save $150). This TV has an impressive 75-inch display and our favorite TV interface even without the substantial price drop.TCL 75-inch smart TV with Fire TV: $550 (save $200). Fire TVs are great if you live in an Alexa household and like to stream movies, and the TCL panels are excellent quality at this size.Toshiba 50-inch 4K TV: $190 (save $130). This affordable smart TV has built-in Alexa functionality and supports Dolby Vision for excellent video quality. Hisense 55-inch ULED 4K smart TV: $650 (save $450). Hisense panels offer excellent color quality, and the 140Hz refresh rate gives a real boost to your gaming experience.  Sony 75-inch Bravia XR X90L LED TV: $1,300 (save $400). This 75-inch model has HDR 10, HLG and Dolby Vision, as well as a refresh rate of 120Hz, voice assistance for hands-free control and the Google TV platform. Best Cyber Monday smart home dealsCyber Monday is the perfect opportunity to upgrade your smart home setup, whether you're eyeing a security camera or multicolored light bulbs. CNET's experts have compiled the best deals you can find on gear that will help with everything from maintaining the ideal temperature to purifying the air you breathe. These high-tech essentials can often be pricey -- but not when these rare deals come around. Roku/CNET Set schedules for holiday lights and more with this smart plug that's rated IP64, making it a highly weather-resistant option for your outdoor needs. Show more With 100 feet of RGBIC waterproof lights, you'll be able to give your home a makeover that you can personalize all year long. At 33% off, it's a great bet for Christmas, but it also has 100 scene modes, can handle pretty extreme temperatures from -4 degrees Fahrenheit up to 140 degrees Fahrenheit. Plus, it works with Alexa and Google Assistant, as well as the Govee Home app.  Named the best air purifier, this smart device stays on top of allergens and pollutants by auto-adjusting to its environment. Breathe in cleaner air with $70 off the regular price. Whether for keeping an eye on your pets or kids, this indoor security camera is equipped with color night vision, 1080p HD video and it's half off. Keep your home the perfect temperature as the cold winds blow this season. This Honeywell thermostat is Energy Star certified and may help you save on your electric bill. This treat-dispensing indoor security camera makes keeping an eye on your pets a lot more fun -- and it's over half off. Philips Hue A19 smart bulb (3-pack): $76 (save $59). Nab three impressive smart light bulbs in this multipack.Kasa smart LED light strip: $15 (save $10). Accent your home with the 16 million different colors of this smart light strip.Veise smart lock: $80 (save $100 with on-page coupon). Upgrade your home security setup with a new smart lock. This lock is easy to set up and can be unlocked in multiple ways, including with your biometrics, a touchscreen keypad, a standard key and more.Blink video doorbell: $30 (save $30). One of the best video doorbells of 2024, this Blink model is ultra-affordable and will help keep an eye on your doorstep or monitor package deliveries, all at half-off.Amazon Echo Pop: $18 (save $22). Amazon's smallest and most budget-friendly Alexa speaker just got cheaper. The Echo Pop is the perfect addition to any smart home, especially if you're just starting out.Best Cyber Monday headphone dealsA good pair of headphones, Airpods or wireless earbuds make relaxing with music easy. Top headphones and earbuds from top brands like Apple, Sony, Bose and more are on sale for Black Friday. We've gathered the best audio deals for you below across multiple big retailers, including Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart. Apple / CNET These super-popular ANC earbuds are $95 off right now. AirPods Pro 2 have top-notch noise-cancelation, impressive sound quality and voice calling performance. They boast an IP54 weather-resistance rating and have a battery life of up to 30 hours with the charging case. Show more Sometimes, you lose an earbud. Sometimes, you just forget the whole set at home. The JLab Go Air Pop are the perfect backup buds: lightweight, compact and long-lasting. They even come with a charging cable built-in, and among the many color variations are a technicolor Fruity Pebbles set and the best colorway of all: translucent like a Game Boy. According to CNET's resident audio expert, the Bose QuietComfort earbuds offer "a lot to like for the price," and they're even more likable at $50 off. They boast solid sound quality that lives up to the Bose reputation, and the sleek, stemless design provides a snug, comfortable fit (for most people). If you want the sound quality of the AirPods Pro with the comfort and security of over-ear headphones, the AirPods Max are for you. The headphones that saved my sanity are $130 off to bring you peace. Kiss those noisy upstairs neighbors and those crying kids on the holiday flight home goodbye with Bose's top-notch noise-canceling headphones. While the spatial audio is neat, the automatic wake/sleep and play/pause based on on-ear detection make the QuietComfort Ultra feel magical. Swapping between multiple devices is also a breeze, even if it's not quite as seamless as Sony. Anker Soundcore Space A40 ANC earbuds: $50 (save $50). Noise-canceling earbuds at half price? Yes, please. Just $50 gets you up to 50 hours of playtime total.Beats Studio Pro x Kim Kardashian: $160 (save $190). The Beats Studio Pro headphones earned a spot on our list of the overall best headphones of the year thanks to their personalized spatial audio and lossless audio support, premium noise canceling, 6 built-in microphones and up to 40 hours of listening time per charge. This partnership with Kim Kardashian brings 3 new colors: Dune, Moon and Earth.Sennheiser Momentum 4: $230 (save $150). A premium pair of ANC headphones for serious audiophiles. These also made our best headphones list.Sony WH-1000XM5: $298 (save $102). Cut out the noise with Sony's flagship headphones. These headphones ranked as one of our favorite pair of headphones, making them an excellent choice. Logitech G733 Lightspeed: $90 (save $60). Logitech's wireless gaming headset works with the PS4 and PC and looks good doing it with the built-in RGB lights. It's at the lowest price in nine months.   Best Cyber Monday tech dealsCyber Monday sales are already in full swing, and that means amazing tech deals. Whether you've been looking to get some electronics for your kid or just replace your outdated tech around the house, our Cyber Monday picks will have something for you. We've picked the best tech deals from top brands like Apple with great discounts on tablets, iPhones and other electronics across retailers like Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart. Oura/CNET Each shade and series of Oura's third-gen ring gets lowest price yet. Show more This 1,800-watt portable power station is great for backup power during inclement weather or wherever you go. It's at its lowest price ever right now. Black Friday dropped the Ultra to the price it should've launched at. Not only does this HD monitor offer sharp image quality with a 1,920x1,080-pixel screen, but it also has adaptive sync. This means it matches up with the refresh rate of your graphics card in your computer, up to 120Hz. It's also very easy on the eyes, with a built-in blue light shield. Futureproof your "one cable" life with Anker's spiffiest cable deal. This 6-foot fast-charging cable is braided for durability and under 20 bucks right now. UE's smallest, newest Bluetooth speaker gets its first big discount. While the Wonderboom usually wins Black Friday, the new Miniroll has stolen our hearts with its ultra-portable form factor and easy-to-mount backstrap. It can party all day (or night) with its 12-hour battery life, and UE finally used USB-C to charge the Miniroll, so no more digging out a micro-USB cable for this micro speaker. Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K Max: $33 (save $27). Give the gift of 4K streaming with the Fire TV Stick. It's the easiest way to add smart features to a nonsmart TV, especially if you're on a budget.Samsung Galaxy S24 (128GB): $660 (save $240). While we've seen this phone go for lower during October Prime Day, this is still a solid deal for Android users looking to upgrade.Belkin power bank: $20 (save $20). Get this portable charger with a 20,000-mAh capacity, a USB-C port and two USB-A ports at half price in either white, silver or rose gold.Sonos Ray: $169 (save $110). This compact soundbar will elevate your bedroom TV-watching experience.Xbox Elite Series 2 controller: $96 (save $44). This wireless gaming controller is compatible with Xbox Series X and Series S, Xbox One, Windows PC, Android and iOS. Liene photo printer: $136 (save $94). Print 4x6 photos straight from your smartphone over Wi-Fi with this printer that uses thermal-dye sublimation for quick and easy photo prints.Anker USB-C charger (2-pack): $12 (save $10). Get two 20-watt chargers and cables you can use with any USB-C compatible device, including recent iPhones and Android phones.Best Cyber Monday laptop and tablet dealsThere are tons of amazing Cyber Monday deals going on. Now is a great time to get a new laptop or Chromebook to replace your aging machine. There are plenty of laptop deals, whether you want a shiny gaming laptop, a reliable MacBook or a budget Chromebook for your kid. If you don't see something you like below, check our complete list of the best Black Friday laptop deals. And for those looking for something more portable, we've gathered great tablet deals that range from low-cost Fire tablets to price cuts on popular iPad models. Apple/CNET With an 11-inch Ultra Retina XDR display, an M4 chip, 256GB of storage and support for Wi-Fi 6E, this powerful Apple tablet is perfect for creatives. Be sure to clip the on-page coupon for the full discount. Show more This 2024 laptop has a touchscreen display, 16GB of RAM and 512GB of SSD storage. It also has the Snapdragon X Elite processor, AI capabilities through Copilot Plus and gets up to 20 hours of battery life. This laptop can handle almost anything you need. It has a 16-inch touchscreen display, an Intel Core i7 processor, 32GB of RAM and a whopping 1TB of storage. You will not find a better touchscreen Chromebook deal under $200. Touchscreens make interacting with Android apps and web games easier, and it often makes interacting with laptops easier for a child used to tablets. This Chromebook will receive updates through June 2033, and up-firing speakers will help those after-homework Youtube videos not sound muffled in your lap. Asus ROG Strix G16 gaming laptop: $1,100 (save $300). With a 16-inch display, Nvidia GeForce RTX 4060 graphics and 1TB of SSD storage, you can easily game on the go. Apple iPad Pro M2 (11-inch): $1,099 (save $400). This previous-gen tablet still packs a punch for creatives looking for a deal.Apple iPad (9th gen): $200 (save $130). This older model is still a good tablet for the basics, especially at this price.Amazon Fire HD 10: $75 (save $65). This tablet has a 10.1-inch display and is a great budget option for streaming content.HP Stream 14-inch BrightView laptop: $263 (save $136). A budget-friendly laptop from a well-known brand. The HP Stream comes with 16GB of RAM, 288GB storage and Office 365 access for a year.Samsung Galaxy Tab A9 Plus 11-inch tablet: $149 (save $71). This affordable Android tablet sports a large 11-inch display and quad speakers for an excellent multimedia experience.Best Cyber Monday kitchen and home dealsCyber Monday is a great time to upgrade your home and kitchen tools without spending a fortune. Whether you've been eyeing a new vacuum or thinking about finally getting that robot vacuum, we've rounded up the best deals for you below. And if you're hunting for budget-friendly options, don't miss our picks for the best Black Friday Deals Under $100 and Under $50. Add this indoor pizza oven to your kitchen arsenal and make personal 12-inch pizzas in just minutes. It has five presets, including a setting for pan pizza, so you can customize your pie exactly how you like it. This model also includes a pizza peel. Show more Cricut's biggest sale of the year has knocked a whopping $100 off this bundle, including one of our favorite, editor-tested Cricut machines. This robot vacuum and mop combo cleaner offers 6,000Pa suction power, reactive AI obstacle avoidance and sonic mapping, a dual rubber brush system to collect pet hair and other debris and a mopping function that uses vibration and downward pressure to remove dried spills and more. The Tymo Hair Straightening Brush combines the functionality of a comb and flat iron in one tool, delivering a super straight and silky look with little effort. With five heat settings, quick heat-up time, anti-scald protection and an auto-off feature -- it's the ultimate time-saving and safe solution for all hair types. Bring the local cafe to your house with a record-low price on the Breville espresso machine. This machine comes with all the bells and whistles, including a beans grinder and a milk frother. Make your fancy coffees at home with the touch of a button and stop dishing out money at the coffee shop every day.  Keep your food warm this holiday season with a warmer mat. Instead of warming things up in the microwave or oven every five minutes, place all your items on the mat so everything stay warm at the same time. And right now, it's back down to its all-time low price. Clip the coupon to get the best price. This cocktail maker will spice up your parties with over 40 craft recipes. Just insert a cocktail capsule, select drink strength, and you're ready to go.  This all in one appliance is a air fryer, toaster and oven. It comes with an impressive 12 presets so no matter what you're making, it'll come out delicious. It goes up to 450 degrees and can fit 21 quarts so you won't have to worry about running out of room. We really recommend taking advantage of this first time deal.  This popular hair tool from Dyson has six attachments, including the Airwrap curling barrels that have revolutionized hair styling. Save a rare $100 on this sleek multifunctional gadget. Tineco Pure One S11 cordless vacuum cleaner: $180 (save $120). This lightweight Tineco was chosen as our pick for the overall best cordless vacuum of the year thanks to its strong suction, HEPA filtration and more. Clip the on-page coupon for the full discount.KitchenAid 5.5-quart Bowl-Lift stand mixer: $280 (save $170). Nothing beats a stand mixer. Add this classic to your kitchen arsenal to make cooking and baking easier.TheraGun Sense massage gun: $199 (save $100). This percussion massager can help tackle muscle soreness and pain. Nespresso Vertuo Pop Plus espresso maker: $100 (save $60). This limited-edition coffee maker looks fantastic on the countertop and can make delicious singles and doubles in a jiffy.Bissell Little Green Carpet Cleaner: $81 (save $42). Grab this viral carpet cleaner at its lowest price since 2019.Solawave 4-in-1 Radiant Renewal facial wand & skin therapy serum bundle: $107 (save $82 with on-page coupon). Rejuvenate your skin in the comfort of your home with this facial wand. Solawave uses red light therapy to tackle signs of aging and other skin issues. When is Cyber Monday?Cyber Monday takes place on Dec. 2nd this year. It always lands the Monday after Thanksgiving in the US, which falls on the fourth Thursday of November. There are hundreds of price cuts and sizable sales from the biggest online retailers, some which exist are carry-overs from Black Friday you can still snag right now and many that are brand new deals to enjoy.Which stores have Cyber Monday sales?Almost all major retailers offer tons of deals and discounts for Cyber Monday. Think the likes of Amazon, Best Buy, Target and Walmart, as well as more specialized retailers such as B&H Photo, GameStop and Dell. Major retailers with brick-and-mortar locations -- such as Target and Walmart -- will be offering online-only savings, whereas Best Buy's Cyber Monday deals are both in-store and online. Keep in mind physical locations can also run out of stock. We've researched Cyber Monday store hours to help you shop in-person, too.When do Cyber Monday sales end?Just like Black Friday, these sales tend to last a few days after the major sales event itself, which is Dec. 2 this year. With this in mind, it's fair to assume offers will run throughout the weekend into early December. Just note that the best deals are expected on the main Cyber Monday date, unless the retailer has decided to extend sales from Black Friday.Are Cyber Monday deals only available online?Generally speaking, yes. Cyber Monday has always existed as a digital version of Black Friday, focused largely on tech deals that exist separate from the first event. As more and more shopping is done online, these two shopping events have started to blend together a little. That doesn't mean all of the deals are the same, but it does mean finding new deals has started to become a greater challenge. When is Cyber Monday?Cyber Monday is scheduled to take place on Dec. 2 this year. The major sale event always takes place the first Monday after Thanksgiving is observed in the US, which is on the fourth Thursday of November each year. Between Black Friday -- which is the day after Thanksgiving -- and Cyber Monday, we see an uptick in sales, though in recent years, the shopping event has become a monthlong bonanza.Best Cyber Monday retailersAmazon: One of the biggest online retailers, Amazon has massive discounts with significant savings on tech, home appliances, and smart home equipment. Walmart: Save big on appliances like televisions, refrigerators, laptops, and more at Walmart's Cyber Monday event.Best Buy: Cyber Monday is historically a great time to buy TVs and Best Buy has you covered for that and more.The Home Depot: Eyeing home improvement tools? Home Depot has the best discounts on tools, appliances, and even grills.Target: Target may not be as big on Cyber Monday as other retailers but it does offer some great deals on toys, gifts and board games.Why are they called Black Friday and Cyber Monday?The term "black" has historically been used to denote distressing or calamitous events. The earliest known use of Black Friday for the Friday after Thanksgiving was to refer to the practice of workers calling in sick the day after Thanksgiving in the early 1950s. Around that same time, US police adopted the term to describe the traffic conditions during the first major holiday shopping date. After attempts to move to the term "Big Friday" failed, merchants attempted to ameliorate the term Black Friday in subsequent years, suggesting that its origin was not due to the terrible traffic the shopping spree created, but because the profit it generated put stores "back in the black" in financial terms. Then, in 2005, the National Retail Federation coined the term "Cyber Monday" because it had noticed a spike in online traffic the Monday following Thanksgiving. At the time, it was believed it was because people were making online purchases while they were at work following the holiday, so their kids couldn't see any gift purchases and because work computers typically had faster internet connections. There was some chatter about calling the date Black Monday or Blue Monday -- because hyperlinks are blue -- but eventually, everyone settled on the more futuristic-sounding Cyber Monday. In 2014, Cyber Monday became the biggest online shopping day in the country.

Our expert, award-winning staff selects the products we cover and rigorously researches and tests our top picks. If you buy through our links, we may get a commission.

Reviews ethics statement

Adam Oram Senior Editor

Adam Oram is a Senior Editor at CNET. He studied Media at Newcastle University and has been writing about technology since 2013. He previously worked as a Senior Writer at iMore, Deals Editor at Thrifter, and as an Apple Genius. His spare time is spent watching football (both kinds), playing Pokémon games, and eating vegan food.

Expertise Deals | Apple

CNET’s expert staff reviews and rates dozens of new products and services each month, building on more than a quarter century of expertise.

Don't worry if you missed Black Friday because Cyber Monday deals have already begun. You still have time to cash in on some of the best discounts of the year, whether you're looking for TVs, laptops, gaming gear, headphones or mattresses. Sorting through the sheer volume of sales can be overwhelming, but we're helping you save time and money by actively tracking all the best deals from Black Friday through Cyber Monday and beyond, so you can skip past the mediocre offers. Check off items on your holiday gift list or treat yourself to a new gadget for your home. Whatever you're looking for, be sure to checkout before these special discounts end.

Consider this page your go-to guide and let us take on the hassle of sorting through the best deals for you. We'll continue to regularly update here with the top picks from CNET's shopping pros, covering Black Friday weekend through Cyber Monday. Be sure to check back often so you don't miss out on the hottest deals.

Best Cyber Monday deals

The latest and greatest ebook reader from Amazon is good for a marathon reading session with its 12 weeks of battery life. Better still, the ebook reader has a refreshed display with even faster page turns and a perfect paper-like contrast ratio. It's the perfect reading companion. 

Blast 80W sound for almost $80 off with this wearable boombox. Soundcore's Motion line brought the noise this year with a slew of great Bluetooth speakers, but the Motion Boom Plus is perfect for bringing to the beach or to the gym when you're leading a yoga class thanks to its long, detachable strap. Its 13,400mAh battery can play 20 hours of music or play power bank to your phone or tablet.

Calling all gamers. If you're looking to get your hands on a new console, grab this deal that brings down Sony's Slim PS5 to the lowest price we've seen.

Get three Outdoor 4 security cameras to help keep your home secure. These cameras are weather-resistant and have a strong battery life using AA lithium batteries. It even made our list of best home security cameras for 2024. You'll also get a free $20 Best Buy gift card with your purchase.

Best Cyber Monday TV deals

As our shopping editors evaluate the best Cyber Monday deals on TVs, we cross-reference the discounts with the results of our rigorous hands-on testing -- and consult our dedicated TV editors and writers, too. These are our favorites right now. 

A 55-inch display is large enough for most spaces, and this particular model is equipped with an OLED screen. It also has Dolby Atmos sound, Dolby Vision, an A11 AI processor with upscaling and gaming features such as Nvidia G Sync, AMD FreeSync Premium and up to 144Hz refresh rate. Snag this TV while it's at an all-time low price.

This 43-inch 4K TV from Sylvox runs Google TV as well, so you can hang out on your deck and stream your favorite shows in the sunshine.

When is Cyber Monday?

Cyber Monday takes place on Dec. 2nd this year. It always lands the Monday after Thanksgiving in the US, which falls on the fourth Thursday of November. There are hundreds of price cuts and sizable sales from the biggest online retailers, some which exist are carry-overs from Black Friday you can still snag right now and many that are brand new deals to enjoy.

Which stores have Cyber Monday sales?

Almost all major retailers offer tons of deals and discounts for Cyber Monday. Think the likes of Amazon, Best Buy, Target and Walmart, as well as more specialized retailers such as B&H Photo, GameStop and Dell. Major retailers with brick-and-mortar locations -- such as Target and Walmart -- will be offering online-only savings, whereas Best Buy's Cyber Monday deals are both in-store and online. Keep in mind physical locations can also run out of stock. We've researched Cyber Monday store hours to help you shop in-person, too.

When do Cyber Monday sales end?

Just like Black Friday, these sales tend to last a few days after the major sales event itself, which is Dec. 2 this year. With this in mind, it's fair to assume offers will run throughout the weekend into early December. Just note that the best deals are expected on the main Cyber Monday date, unless the retailer has decided to extend sales from Black Friday.

Are Cyber Monday deals only available online?

Generally speaking, yes. Cyber Monday has always existed as a digital version of Black Friday, focused largely on tech deals that exist separate from the first event. As more and more shopping is done online, these two shopping events have started to blend together a little. That doesn't mean all of the deals are the same, but it does mean finding new deals has started to become a greater challenge. 

When is Cyber Monday?

Cyber Monday is scheduled to take place on Dec. 2 this year. The major sale event always takes place the first Monday after Thanksgiving is observed in the US, which is on the fourth Thursday of November each year. Between Black Friday -- which is the day after Thanksgiving -- and Cyber Monday, we see an uptick in sales, though in recent years, the shopping event has become a monthlong bonanza.

Best Cyber Monday retailers

  • Amazon: One of the biggest online retailers, Amazon has massive discounts with significant savings on tech, home appliances, and smart home equipment. 
  • Walmart: Save big on appliances like televisions, refrigerators, laptops, and more at Walmart's Cyber Monday event.
  • Best Buy: Cyber Monday is historically a great time to buy TVs and Best Buy has you covered for that and more.
  • The Home Depot: Eyeing home improvement tools? Home Depot has the best discounts on tools, appliances, and even grills.
  • Target: Target may not be as big on Cyber Monday as other retailers but it does offer some great deals on toys, gifts and board games.

Why are they called Black Friday and Cyber Monday?

The term "black" has historically been used to denote distressing or calamitous events. The earliest known use of Black Friday for the Friday after Thanksgiving was to refer to the practice of workers calling in sick the day after Thanksgiving in the early 1950s. Around that same time, US police adopted the term to describe the traffic conditions during the first major holiday shopping date. 

After attempts to move to the term "Big Friday" failed, merchants attempted to ameliorate the term Black Friday in subsequent years, suggesting that its origin was not due to the terrible traffic the shopping spree created, but because the profit it generated put stores "back in the black" in financial terms. 

Then, in 2005, the National Retail Federation coined the term "Cyber Monday" because it had noticed a spike in online traffic the Monday following Thanksgiving. At the time, it was believed it was because people were making online purchases while they were at work following the holiday, so their kids couldn't see any gift purchases and because work computers typically had faster internet connections. There was some chatter about calling the date Black Monday or Blue Monday -- because hyperlinks are blue -- but eventually, everyone settled on the more futuristic-sounding Cyber Monday. In 2014, Cyber Monday became the biggest online shopping day in the country.
